summary: This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons chain of custody log for items recovered from Jeffrey Epstein's cell (9 South 206-220-LAD) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 12, 2019. It details the seizure of personal items, medications, and correspondence as evidence following his death.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffery
persons.context: The suspect from whose cell the evidence items were recovered. Listed with inmate number 76318-054.

events.title: Evidence Recovery from Epstein's Cell
events.description: Items were recovered from Jeffrey Epstein's cell (location 9 South 206-220-LAD) at 12:55 PM and subsequently placed into evidence custody.

events.title: Evidence Transfer to SIS Office
events.description: The recovered evidence was released to the Special Investigative Supervisor (SIS) Office at 1:10 PM on the same day.

locations: 9 South 206-220-LAD (Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
SIS Office (Special Investigative Supervisor office within the prison)
keyFacts: Evidence was collected from Jeffrey Epstein's prison cell on August 12, 2019, the day after his death.
Recovered items included medications (pain relief, methylprednisolone, milk of magnesia), personal items (glasses, bible, headphones), and correspondence (letter mail, an AED envelope).
One item was described as a 'brown paper bag with writing "SW U2 dinner"', potentially indicating social connections or plans.
The evidence was formally logged under FBI case numbers (NYM-19-0176, NYM-19-0177, NYM-19-0178) and transferred to the prison's Special Investigative Supervisor (SIS) Office.
